In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function to wrap text to a specified text width in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        if isempty(line) 
            line = word
        else
            line = line * " " * word  
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

It splits the input text into words, then iterates through appending each word to a line string. When adding the next word would exceed the text width, it starts a new line. Finally it joins the lines with newline characters and returns the wrapped text.

Example usage:

```julia
text = "This is a test text that will wrap across multiple lines"

wrapped = wrap_string(text) 
println(wrapped)

# Output:
# This is a 
# test text 
# that will 
# wrap across
# multiple 
# lines
```

So it wraps the long input text to lines of maximum 10 characters width.
